contentrichtext.text: '''''The Nigger''''' is a play by American playwright [[Edward Sheldon]] (1886â€“1946). It explores the relationship between [[black people|blacks]] and [[white people|whites]] in the melodrama of a politician faced with a sudden, personal dilemma. The play was first performed on Broadway in [[New York City]] at [[Century Theatre (New York City)|The New Theatre]] on December 4, 1909.<ref> Anthony Slide, ''American Racist: The Life and Films of Thomas Dixon'' (University Press of Kentucky, 2004), p65</ref> The play was adapted to a novel, and a film adaptation, directed by [[Edgar Lewis]], was made in 1915.<ref>[http://www.novelguide.com/a/discover/dfs_18/dfs_18_00018.html novelguide.com]</ref> Because the title was controversial, the film was released in some markets as '''''The New Governor'''''. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://books.google.com/books?id=5zYqAAAAMAAJ "The Nigger": An American Play in Three Acts] at [[Google Books]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Nigger, The}} [[Category:American plays]] [[Category:Plays about race and ethnicity]] [[Category:Plays adapted into films]] [[Category:1909 plays]] [[Category:Melodramas]] [[Category:Broadway plays]] {{1910s-play-stub}}
